messages.Optimization.processing_mesh_no_shapekey: Processing mesh with no shapekeys named "{mesh_name}"
messages.Optimization.remove_doubles_safely.desc:
Remove duplicate vertices while preserving important features like mouth shapes.
Is a quick solution but does not merge vertices that move at all.
messages.Optimization.remove_doubles_safely.label: Remove Doubles Safely
messages.Optimization.remove_doubles_safely_advan:
Remove duplicate vertices while preserving important features like mouth shapes.
Unlike basic, Advanced will merge vertices together that move, but still preserve shapekeys.
Ex: It will not seal the lips of the mouth closed, but will fix split polygons that make up the lips.
messages.Optimization.select_at_least_two_meshes: Please select at least two mesh objects
messages.Optimization.vertex_excluded: Shapekey has a moved vertex at index "{index}", excluding from double merging!

messages.Quick_Access.apply_pose_as_shapekey.desc:
Makes the current pose a shapekey that can be activated later.
This is good for applying a jaw open position as a shapekey for facial movements.
messages.Quick_Access.stop_pose_mode.label: Exit Pose Mode

messages.UVTools.align_uv_to_target.warning.too_m: Error! You have way to much stuff selected. Are you sure you're selecting two edges?
messages.UVTools.align_uv_to_target.warning.need_: You need one line of selected uv points per selected object. Object "{obj}" does not meet this requirement!
Aligns a selected line of UV points on each selected mesh
to the line of selected uv points on the active mesh.
Useful for kitbashing textures of one model onto another.
Uses distance from the 2D cursor to identify the start of the line of uv points on each mesh.
